title: Ukrainian drones strike a major military depot in a Russian town northwest of Moscow
summary: At least 13 people were injured, Russia's Health Ministry added . Ukraine claimed the strike destroyed military warehouses in Toropets, a town in Russia's Tver region . The attack was carried out by Ukraine’s Security Service, a Kyiv security official said .  The facility caught fire in the strike and was burning across an area 6 kilometers (4 miles) wide, a Ukrainian intelligence official says . Among the destroyed ammunition were North Korean KN-23 short-range ballistic missiles, the official said . Russia and North Korea signed a pact in June that envisioned mutual military assistance between Moscow and Pyongyang .  Ukraine is seeking approval from Western nations for weapons they are providing to hit targets inside Russia . Some Western leaders have balked at that, fearing they could be dragged into the conflict .  The U.K. Defense Ministry estimates the war has probably killed or wounded more than 600,000 Russian troops . Putin ordered the country’s military to increase its number of troops by 180,000 to a total of 1.5 million by Dec. 1 .  /hub/russia-ukraine. /hub: Russia, Ukraine, Russia and Ukraine . /hub.com: Ukraine, Ukraine and Russia.com .

title: Ukrainian drone attack triggers earthquake-sized blast at arsenal in Russia's Tver region
summary: Unverified video and images on social media showed a huge ball of flame blasting high into the night sky and multiple detonations thundering across a lake about 380 km (240 miles) west of Moscow . NASA satellites picked up intense heat sources emanating from an area of about 14 square kilometres (5 square miles) at the site .  Russia and Ukraine each reported dozens of enemy drone attacks on their territory overnight . State media, which is now subject to military censorship laws, was muted in its reporting on Wednesday .  The size of the main blast was consistent with 200-240 tons of high explosives detonating, an analyst says . A Toropets chatroom on the Russian social media site VK was flooded with messages of support from other parts of the country .  Toropets, a 1,000-year-old town, has a population of just over 11,000 . Deputy defence minister said in 2018 that the facility could defend weapons from missiles and even a small nuclear attack . Russia said it had destroyed 54 drones launched against five Russian regions overnight .  Russia says three guided air missiles did not reach their targets overnight . Russia says it used three missiles which did not hit their targets . Ukraine says it has been hit by a missile strike in the past two days .

title: Florida sheriff releases mug shot of 11-year-old charged with making school shooting threat
summary: Florida sheriff releases mug shot and video of 11-year-old boy charged with felony for allegedly making a written threat of a mass shooting . Sheriff: "Since parents, you don't want to raise your kids, I'm gonna start raising them"  Detectives were alerted through Fortify Florida, which allows people to make anonymous reports of suspicious activity to law enforcement and school officials . Detectives recovered airsoft rifles, pistols and fake ammunition along with knives, swords and other weapons . The boy was arrested after threatening to commit shooting at Creekside or Silver Sands Middle School .  The alleged list of targets was also recovered . "Go talk to those parents and see how funny this is," the mother-of-one said .  The 11-year-old's arrest came days after two other students were taken into custody for allegedly posting threats on TikTok and Instagram . Sheriff: "So parents, do your job. Don’t let Sheriff Chitwood raise our kids. This is absolutely ridiculous"  "Parents and community members should reinforce the seriousness of these offenses to your children," officials say . The school says it is seeking the support of parents, community members and parents .

title: 11-Year-Old Arrested After Mass School Shooting Threat: Sheriff
summary:
Shocking video shows an 11-year-old under arrest. The local sheriff says he is starting a new policy of posting video showing minor's faces on social media. Sheriff Mike Chitwood of Volusia County, Florida says the youngster threatened to commit a "mass shooting" at a school outside Daytona Beach. The sheriff says he was driven to this extraordinary step of allowing a minor's face to be shown after a wave of threats made to schools in his county.
